title: Conditions Impacting Maternal Wellness by US State
text:
Problem & objectives
Your Introduction will fully explain and describe the problem (or question or issue), its history, who it affects, why it matters, etc.
For example, start with a clearly defined problem: A government contractor is experiencing rising costs and is no longer able to submit competitive contract proposals. One of many questions to solve this business problem might include: Can the company reduce its staff without compromising quality?

title: website
text:

Incorrect values

General data consistency
Data formatting
Outliers
Normalization
Transformation (as needed)
Removing unnecessary columns

title: Bibliography
text:
References

Adkins, S., Talmor, N., White, M. H., Dutton, C., & O’Donoghue, A. L. (2024). Association between restricted abortion access and child entries into the foster care system. JAMA Pediatrics, 178(1), 37–44.


Bureau of Labor Statistics. (2024). Number of obstetricians and gynecologists employed in the united states in 2023, by state [graph]. In Statista.


Cohen, D. S., Donley, G., & Rebouché, R. (2023). The new abortion battleground. Colum. L. Rev., 123, 1.


Collins, S. R., & al., et. (2024). 2024 state scorecard on women’s health and reproductive care. Commonwealth Fund.


Guttmacher, A. F. (1956). Factors affecting normal expectancy of conception. Journal of the American Medical Association, 161(9), 855–860.


Hoyert, D. L. (2023). Maternal mortality rates in the united states, 2021. NCHS Health E-Stats. https://doi.org/10.15620/cdc:124678


Kaiser Family Foundation (KFF). (2024). State health facts: Births financed by medicaid.


O’Neill, S. (2022). Fertility trends and the rising costs of children.


Wallace, M. E., Stoecker, C., Sauter, S., & Vilda, D. (2024). States’ abortion laws associated with intimate partner violence–related homicide of women and girls in the US, 2014–20: Study examines the association of abortion laws to intimate partner violence of women and girls. Health Affairs, 43(5), 682–690.


Wallace, M., Gillispie-Bell, V., Cruz, K., Davis, K., & Vilda, D. (2021). Homicide during pregnancy and the postpartum period in the united states, 2018–2019. Obstetrics & Gynecology, 138(5), 762–769.

title: Conditions Impacting Maternal Wellness by US State
text:
Research Questions




flowchart TD

  A(Association Between Abortion Policy and Health Outcomes):::main

  A --> B(Maternal Health):::sub
  B --> X(Maternal Mortality):::node
  B --> V(Cost Barriers):::node
  B --> H(Uninsured Women During Pregnancy):::node

  A --> C(Maternal Wellness):::sub
  C --> G(Economic Wellness)
  G --> W(Parental Leave)
  G --> I(Women in the Workforce)
  G --> J(Teen Birth Rate)
  C --> K(Education Wellness)
  K --> L(Higher Education)
  C --> M(Mental Health)
  M --> N(Postpartum Depression)
  M --> O(Intimate Partner Violence)
  
  
  A --> D(Overall Health):::sub
  D --> P(Ratio of OBGYN)
  D --> Q(Health Coverage)
  D --> R(Medicaid Expansion)
  D --> S(Contraception Coverage)

  A --> E(Child Health )
  E --> T(Infant Mortality)
  
  A --> F(Child Wellness)
  F --> U(Foster Care)
